item.title: Beginnings
item.dc:creator: Rekka Bellum
item.description:
Somewhere in my early thirties I began to think about boats and sailing and the sea. More than anything, this felt as though my dad's dream had accidentally found its way to me. He has been interested in yachts for as long as I can remember, telling us that he and my mum would have been cruising if not for the fact that she gets terribly sea-sick. They remained on land and became good parents to four children instead.

So perhaps it had never been my dream, but it wasn't entirely out of the blue. Sailing made occasional appearances that must have influenced me. A large black and white photograph by {_Beken of Cowes_} of a heeling sailboat hanging in my parents house, plans for building a wooden rowboat rolled up in a tube, a day trip aboard the {_Young Endeavour_} with dad and my brother. Throughout all of this was a search for a book called {_John G. Alden and His Yacht Designs_}, which involved asking at every library and bookseller for years. Dad had to wait for the internet to come along before he found a copy.

Continue Reading
